factoid: Rostóv said, "Yes, sir, and there’s a light in your father’s study."
Rostóv asked, "Then they’ve not gone to bed yet?"
Rostóv said, "What do you think?"
Rostóv said, "Mind now, don’t forget to put out Rostóv's new coat."
Rostóv shouted, "Now then, get on," to the driver.
Rostóv shouted, "Do wake up, Váska!"
Rostóv turned to Denísov, whose head was again nodding.
Rostóv shouted, "Come, get on! You shall have three rubles for vodka—get on!"
The sleigh was only three houses from Rostóv’s door.
The horses were not moving at all.
The sleigh bore to the right.
The sleigh drew up at an entrance.
Rostóv saw overhead the old familiar cornice with a bit of plaster broken off.
Rostóv saw the porch.
Rostóv saw the post by the side of the pavement.
Rostóv sprang out before the sleigh stopped.
Rostóv ran into the hall.
The house stood cold and silent.
The house was cold and silent as if regardless of who had come to it.
There was no one in the hall.
Rostóv thought, "Oh God! Is everyone all right?"
Rostóv stopped for a moment with a sinking heart.
Rostóv started to run along the hall and up the warped steps of the familiar staircase.
The well-known old door handle turned as loosely as ever.
The well-known old door handle angered the countess when it was not properly cleaned.
A solitary tallow candle burned in the anteroom.
Old Michael was asleep on the chest.
Prokófy, the footman, was so strong that Prokófy could lift the back of the carriage from behind.
Prokófy sat plaiting slippers out of cloth selvedges.
Prokófy looked up at the opening door.
Prokófy’s expression of sleepy indifference suddenly changed to one of delighted amazement.
Prokófy cried, "Gracious heavens! The young count!"
Prokófy recognized the young master.
Prokófy said, "Can it be? My treasure!"
Prokófy trembled with excitement.
Prokófy rushed toward the drawing room door.
Prokófy came back and stooped to kiss the young man’s shoulder.
Rostóv asked, "All well?"
Rostóv drew away his arm.
Rostóv said, "Yes, God be thanked! Yes! They’ve just finished supper. Let me have a look at you, your excellency."
Rostóv asked, "Is everything quite all right?"
Rostóv said, "The Lord be thanked, yes!"
Rostóv had completely forgotten Denísov.
Rostóv did not wish anyone to forestall him.
Rostóv threw off his fur coat.
Rostóv ran on tiptoe through the large dark ballroom.
The ballroom had the same old card tables.
The ballroom had the same chandelier with a cover over it.
Someone had already seen the young master.
Before the young master had reached the drawing room, something flew out from a side door like a tornado.
The something began hugging and kissing the young master.
Another creature of the same kind sprang from a second door.
A third creature of the same kind sprang from a third door.
The creatures hugged, kissed, shouted, and cried tears of joy.
The young master could not distinguish which was Papa.
The young master could not distinguish which was Natásha.
The young master could not distinguish which was Pétya.
Everyone shouted, talked, and kissed the young master at the same time.
The young master’s mother was not there.
The young master noticed that his mother was not there.
The young master said, "And I did not know... Nicholas... My darling!..."
The young master said, "Here he is... our own... Kólya, dear fellow... How he has changed!... Where are the candles?... Tea!..."
Sónya hugged the young master.
Natásha hugged the young master.
Pétya hugged the young master.
Anna Mikháylovna hugged the young master.
Véra hugged the young master.
The old count hugged the young master.
The serfs hugged the young master.
Men hugged the young master.
Maids hugged the young master.
The serfs, men, and maids flocked into the room.
The serfs, men, and maids exclaiming and oh-ing and ah-ing.
Pétya clinging to the young master’s legs kept shouting, "And me too!"
Natásha pulled the young master down toward her and covered his face with kisses.
Natásha held the young master tight by the skirt of his coat.
Natásha sprang away and pranced up and down in one place like a goat.
Natásha shrieked piercingly.
All around were loving eyes glistening with tears of joy.
All around were lips seeking a kiss.
The young master was kissed by many.
